content:
legislatures wide latitude in formulating these laws. Flagrant
violations of the equal protection clause could lead to the decision that the
law was unconstitutional, but only if the law failed what became known as
the rational-relation test.This test required only that the unequal treatment of
individuals be reasonably likely to achieve some legitimate end.
A final issue was whether the Fourteenth Amendment protected only the
civil rights of citizens or also rights of other kinds. In Strauder v
